moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. Bc4: some players, still try to get away with this fake threat: Ng5, threatens pawn f7; the fools' mate...
moves.3... Bg7 4. a3: a bit beside the point: I would say...
moves.4... e6 5. Nc3 a6: time to include the Najdorf extension: Nb5 is not what we want...
moves.6. O-O Ne7 7. Qe2: not sure, where she is going...
moves.8... d5: trust me: in most cases, this opening does not run so smooth: White just does not have a clue...
moves.9. Ba2: not the best: at least, White has to play exd5, exd5: this will soon run sour...
moves.9... d4: no rocket science involved here: after Na4, most likely Qa5, and blow up Whites' Queens wing...
moves.16. e5: giving the circumstances, not very wise...
moves.16... a5 17. Na3 axb4 18. Nxb5 bxc3: a costly mistake: Nb5 has no future...
moves.21. Nxd4 Bd5: White has won back a pawn: Black is winning the middle game...
moves.22. Nd4b5 Qb6 23. Be3 Rxa1: also Bxe5, is an important threat: White does not take the risk, of accepting Blacks' Queen sacrifice...
moves.26. Nce4: clearly lost, from the straight path...
moves.26... Bxa1 27. Qf3: clearly desperate: already, f5, will cost a full piece...
moves.31. Bxe5: pure stupidity: Qxd6, was an option...
moves.31... Qxf6 32. Bxf6 Nec6: very sobering: this experience for White...
moves.33. Be7: so he plays this: in one last attempt...
moves.33... Nxe7: so I had to kill him...

gameName: fiercequeen, back to what she does best...
